author: Daisy Mowke
content: Mahesh Bhatt, coming out in support of Sushmita Sen who recently announced she's dating Lalit Modi, also shared how she met her former partner Vikram Bhatt. "During the making of 'Dastak', Vikram's romance with Sushmita started in Seychelles," he stated. "Vikram was my right hand...doing most of my work. So, he used to interact with her more vigorously," Bhatt added.
title: Vikram Bhatt's romance with Sushmita started during 'Dastak' making in Seychelles: Mahesh

author: Daisy Mowke
content: Tanushree Dutta has claimed that she's being "harassed and targeted very badly". She added that she won't die by suicide and she'll resurrect her career. "Bollywood Mafia, the old political circuit of Maharashtra...and nefarious anti-national criminal elements together usually operate like this to trouble people. I'm very sure the #metoo culprits...are behind all this," said Tanushree.
title: Tanushree claims she's being harassed by Bollywood mafia, says 'I won't die by suicide'

author: Daisy Mowke
content: Tom Cruise has become Hollywood's highest earning actor, after he earned more than $100 million for 'Top Gun: Maverick', as per Variety. Will Smith came second with $35 million for his upcoming film 'Emancipation', followed by Leonardo DiCaprio and Brad Pitt, at $30 million each, for 'Killers of the Flower Moon' and an upcoming untitled Formula 1 drama, respectively.
title: Salaries of top Hollywood stars released; Tom Cruise earns most with $100 million

author: Daisy Mowke
content: Filmmaker Mahesh Bhatt, speaking about Sushmita Sen, told ETimes, "She has the guts to live on her own dictates." "My personal belief is that we must in the second decade of...21st century give human beings...right to live life on their own terms," he added. Sushmita recently announced that she is dating Lalit Modi.
title: In 21st century, we must give people right to live life on own terms: Mahesh on Sushmita

author: Daisy Mowke
content: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has registered a case of money laundering against producer Prerna Arora, known for producing films including 'Pad Man' and 'Toilet - Ek Prem Katha'. Prerna allegedly faces fraud charges of ₹31 crore. ED summoned her today but she didn't appear as she's not in Mumbai. On her behalf, her lawyer reached the ED office and sought time.
title: 'Pad Man' producer Prerna Arora charged with money laundering in alleged fraud of ₹31cr

author: Daisy Mowke
content: Tom Cruise has become Hollywood's highest earning actor, after he earned more than $100 million for 'Top Gun: Maverick', as per Variety. Will Smith came second with $35 million for his upcoming film 'Emancipation', followed by Leonardo DiCaprio and Brad Pitt, at $30 million each, for 'Killers of the Flower Moon' and an upcoming untitled Formula 1 drama, respectively.
title: What are the salaries of Hollywood stars as Tom Cruise tops list with $100 million?

author: Arnab Mukherji
content: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli, who directed 'RRR' and the 'Baahubali' film franchise, said he "undoubtedly" wants to go even "bigger" and "wilder" than 'RRR'. "There is never enough for me...To the brink, and nothing less," added Rajamouli. Reacting to criticism over alleged jingoism in his films, Rajamouli stated, "I feel they're just being blind...I don't believe in God [or any religion]."
title: I want to undoubtedly go even bigger and wilder than RRR: Rajamouli

author: Amartya Sharma
content: Actor Riteish Deshmukh, who has featured in films like 'Masti', 'Grand Masti', 'Kyaa Kool Hai Hum', has said he is the "only actor" to do "four to five sex comedies". "I'm not ashamed of that...I never thought, what would my son think in the future," he added. He stated he did those films when his father was Maharashtra's Chief Minister.
title: I'm only actor to do 4-5 sex comedies, I'm not ashamed: Riteish Deshmukh

author: Amartya Sharma
content: Taking to Instagram, Karan Johar praised Alia Bhatt's upcoming film 'Darlings'. "So fun! So hard-hitting and so engaging! All at once...Congratulations my baby girl Alia, what a brave decision to begin your producer journey with," he captioned the post. Karan praised Shah Rukh Khan and his wife Gauri Khan for giving a "green light" to the project.
title: So hard-hitting & engaging: Karan Johar on Alia Bhatt's 'Darlings'

author: Amartya Sharma
content: Actress Janhvi Kapoor opened up about her sister Khushi Kapoor's debut film 'The Archies'.  "I've seen my sister work tirelessly...work really hard and she's auditioning for this role," she stated. Janhvi added, "She wanted this so badly, I'm just so happy for her and I hope it goes well." The film also features Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana Khan.
title: I've seen sister Khushi work hard & tirelessly for 'The Archies': Janhvi

author: Arnab Mukherji
content: Discussing the film 'Partner' where he starred with actor Salman Khan, actor Govinda said, "Once I was leaving the set and randomly...told Salman...'You won't look back after this film', and that's...what happened." "Salman and I...have a love-hate relationship," Govinda had said, discussing their relationship. Salman had shared that he was "very scared" to act with Govinda at one point.
title: Told Salman 'You won't look back after this film': Govinda on 'Partner'

author: Amartya Sharma
content: Discussing the films he makes, producer Ronnie Screwvala said he likes to tell stories that can make a difference. Screwvala added he doesn't relate to the "fragile entertainment" of the Johars and the Chopras. However, he stated it doesn't mean their entertainment isn't good. "They pack in all the stars...the songs...people want that kind of entertainment too," he concluded.
title: Don't relate to fragile entertainment of Johars, Chopras: Screwvala

author: Amartya Sharma
content: Filmmaker Farah Khan recalled a critic's reaction to her directorial debut film 'Main Hoon Na', which starred Shah Rukh Khan. Farah revealed a critic had given her film half a star and the headline read 'Main Hoon Naaaah!'. "It held strongly on Monday...Tuesday (after the first weekend)...I was like 'F**k the reviews. People are loving the film'," she added.
title: Critic gave half a star to 'Main...', was like 'F**k the reviews': Farah Khan

author: Arnab Mukherji
content: Actress Shabana Azmi said she would spend more time with actor Naseeruddin Shah than with her husband and lyricist Javed Akhtar at one point, as they did many films together. "We never became friends...He had great regard for my mother Shaukat Kaifi," added Shabana. Naseeruddin had earlier termed 'Bhaag Milkha Bhaag' starring Shabana's stepson Farhan Akhtar as "completely fake".
title: Spent more time with Naseeruddin than Javed, never became friends: Shabana

author: Amartya Sharma
content: Composer-singer Anirudh Ravichander, speaking about composing music for Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 'Jawan', has said that he never had a "specific dream" about making his debut in Bollywood. "I grew up watching Shah Rukh sir's films and I am a big fan...it's going to be a great experience for all of us," he further added.
title: Grew up watching SRK's films: Anirudh on composing music for 'Jawan'

author: Amartya Sharma
content: Actress Ana De Armas, who had featured in the James Bond film 'No Time to Die', has said that there is no need for female James Bond. "There shouldn't be any need to steal someone else's character...to take over," she stated. However, Ana added actresses in the upcoming James Bond films should be given a more substantial part and recognition.
title: No need for female James Bond: 'No Time to Die' actress Ana De Armas

author: Arnab Mukherji
content: Discussing the arrival of his first child following his recent marriage to actress Alia Bhatt, actor Ranbir Kapoor said, "The nervousness and...anxiety for such a thing doesn't compare to anything." "It's beyond [comparison]," added Ranbir. Recently when asked to share two truths and a lie, Ranbir had mentioned having twins along with taking a long break from acting.
title: The anxiety is beyond comparison: Ranbir Kapoor on becoming a father

author: Amartya Sharma
content: 'Shamshera' director Karan Malhotra opened up about actor Sanjay Dutt's battle with cancer during the film's shoot. "The news that Sanjay sir had been diagnosed with cancer came to all of us like a huge shock. We had no idea about it," he stated. Calling Sanjay a superman, Karan said, "He is an inspiration on the sets for everyone."
title: Sanjay Dutt's cancer diagnosis came as shock to us: 'Shamshera' director

author: Amartya Sharma
content: Actress Ananya Panday has revealed that she has been a fan of actress Alia Bhatt "all along". "I love her work...I love her spirit. I'm always looking forward to her work," she added. Speaking about Alia, Ananya further said, "There's so much she packs in, with so much nuance and novelty....she has some amazing pieces of work to her credit."
title: I love Alia Bhatt's work & her spirit, I look forward to her work: Ananya

author: Amartya Sharma
content: Actress Raveena Tandon said that there might be a rivalry between actresses, however, it's a good and healthy rivalry as it brings out the best in them. "Actresses I've worked with have been friends for so long. It's not necessary for you to get along with everyone," she added while speaking about the rivalry between actresses in the early days.
title: There might be rivalry between actresses, but it’s good: Raveena Tandon

author: Amartya Sharma
content: Filmmaker Joe Russo has arrived in Mumbai ahead of the premiere of his upcoming film 'The Gray Man'. Pictures of 'The Gray Man' co-director Joe Russo have surfaced as he was spotted at the Kalina airport in Mumbai. Dhanush, who is part of the film, also arrived in Mumbai. Ryan Gosling and Chris Evans star in the film.
title: Joe Russo arrives in Mumbai ahead of 'The Gray Man' premiere, pics surface

author: Amartya Sharma
content: Actor Manoj Bajpayee has refuted the reports that suggested the actor will be playing a police officer in Allu Arjun-starrer 'Pushpa: The Rise' sequel. Sharing a news report on Twitter, Manoj wrote, "Kahan kahan se samachar laate hai aap log (From where do you guys get such news?)?" The 2021 film was directed by Sukumar.
title: Manoj Bajpayee refutes reports of playing a police officer in 'Pushpa 2'

author: Arnab Mukherji
content: Discussing his film 'The Gray Man' which has been directed by Anthony and Joe Russo, who have also directed 'Avengers: Endgame', actor Dhanush said, "I was very surprised they knew about me." "Whenever I had a conversation with [anyone from the team]...I'd be like...'How do the Russos know about me?'" added Dhanush. "It went on [and] on," he stated.
title: Asked every 'The...' crew member 'How do the Russos know me?': Dhanush

author: Amartya Sharma
content: Producer DVV Danayya, who also produced SS Rajamouli's 'RRR', has said that his upcoming project with actor Prabhas will go on the floors in September. He further revealed that the film will completely be shot in India and the process of casting the leading lady for the film is going on. The film will be a supernatural action thriller.
title: Film with Prabhas will go on the floors in September: 'RRR' producer

author: Arnab Mukherji
content: Fans of actor Vijay Deverakonda, who will be seen in the film 'Liger' and starred in the movie 'Arjun Reddy', reportedly erected a 75-feet banner where the actor can be seen shirtless, at Sudarshan 35MM theatre in Hyderabad. The banner has been put for the trailer launch of 'Liger' which will take place tomorrow. 'Liger' marks Vijay's first Bollywood film.
title: Fans erect 75-feet banner of 'Liger' actor Vijay Deverakonda in Hyderabad
